questions.question: James said that he ………………….. his friends for dinner.
questions.description: James said, 'I have invited my friends.' Present perfect in the direct speech becomes past perfect in the indirect speech.

questions.question: Stella said that she ……………………….. her friends.
questions.description: Will in direct speech becomes would in indirect speech.

questions.question: They wondered what they ………………………… for dinner.
questions.description: Will in direct speech becomes would in indirect speech.

questions.question: Mother asked what I ……………………….. in my room.
questions.description: 'What are you doing in your room?' asked mother. Present continuous tense in direct speech becomes past continuous in indirect speech.

questions.question: I warned him ……………………………. careful.
questions.description: 'Be careful,' I told him. I warned him to be careful. We use to-infinitives to report imperatives.

questions.question: She cried that there …………………………. a cockroach on her table.
questions.description: 'There is a cockroach on my table,' she cried. Is in the direct speech becomes was in the indirect speech.

questions.question: She asked me if she ………………………… a message with me.
The child said that she ………………………. afraid.
The doctor recommended that I ……………………………… increase my intake of fruits and vegetables.
She cried that she …………………………..
questions.description: 'I have been duped,' she cried. / She cried that she had been duped.

questions.question: They told him ………………………….. off.
questions.description: 'Be off,' they told him. They told him to off. We use to-infinitives to report imperatives.
